CS0103.title: The name does not exist in the current context
CS0103.explanation: The compiler cannot find the specified identifier. This usually means you're trying to use a variable, method, or type that hasn't been defined or isn't accessible in the current scope.
commonCauses: Typo in variable, method, or type name
Missing using directive for a namespace
Variable declared in a different scope
suggestedFixes: Check for typos in the identifier name
Add the required 'using' directive at the top of the file
Add a package reference using 'dotnet add package'
Verify the identifier is declared in the current scope

CS0246.title: Type or namespace not found
CS0246.explanation: The compiler cannot find a type or namespace. This typically occurs when a required package isn't referenced or a using directive is missing.
commonCauses: Typo in type or namespace name
Wrong target framework for the package
suggestedFixes: Add the NuGet package: dotnet add package <PackageName>
Add using directive for the namespace
Verify the package supports your target framework
Check for typos in type or namespace name

CS1001.title: Identifier expected
CS1001.explanation: The compiler expected an identifier but found something else. This is usually a syntax error.
suggestedFixes: Review the syntax at the error location
Ensure all declarations have proper identifiers
Check for missing or extra punctuation

CS1002.title: Expected semicolon
CS1002.explanation: A semicolon is required but missing. In C#, most statements must end with a semicolon.
commonCauses: Forgot to add semicolon at end of statement
suggestedFixes: Add a semicolon at the end of the statement
Check the previous line for syntax errors
Ensure all statements are properly terminated

CS1513.title: Expected closing brace
CS1513.explanation: A closing brace '}' is expected but not found. This indicates mismatched braces in your code.
commonCauses: Missing closing brace for class, method, or block
suggestedFixes: Use IDE brace matching to find unmatched braces
Review code structure for proper nesting
Format code to identify structural issues

CS0116.title: Namespace does not directly contain members
CS0116.explanation: Types must be declared inside a namespace or class, not directly in a namespace without being wrapped in a type declaration.
commonCauses: Code placed directly in namespace without class/struct/enum
suggestedFixes: Wrap code in a class, struct, or other type declaration
Check for misplaced or missing braces
Move executable code inside a type definition

MSB3644.title: Reference assemblies not found
MSB3644.explanation: The .NET reference assemblies for the target framework are not installed. This prevents the project from building.
suggestedFixes: Install the .NET SDK for the target framework
Install the targeting pack: dotnet install sdk <version>
Change target framework to an installed version

MSB4236.title: SDK not found
MSB4236.explanation: MSBuild cannot locate the specified SDK. This is typically a .NET SDK installation issue.
suggestedFixes: Verify SDK is in PATH: dotnet --version
Check global.json for SDK version requirements
Remove global.json or update SDK version requirement

MSB1003.title: Project or solution file not found
MSB1003.explanation: MSBuild cannot find a project or solution file in the specified location or current directory.
commonCauses: No .csproj or .sln file in current directory
suggestedFixes: Specify project file explicitly: dotnet build <path>
Navigate to directory containing .csproj or .sln file
Verify project file exists at specified path
Check for typos in file path
Create a new project: dotnet new <template>

NU1101.title: Unable to find package
NU1101.explanation: NuGet cannot locate the specified package in any configured package source. The package may not exist or the name may be incorrect.
suggestedFixes: Search for package: dotnet package search <name>
Authenticate to private feed if required

NU1102.title: Unable to find package with version
NU1102.explanation: NuGet can find the package but not the specific version requested. The version may not exist or may have been unlisted.
commonCauses: Package source doesn't have that version
suggestedFixes: Remove version constraint to get latest
Search package versions: dotnet package search <name> --take 10

NU1103.title: Unable to find stable package
NU1103.explanation: NuGet can only find prerelease versions of the package, but a stable version was requested.
commonCauses: Package hasn't released stable version yet
suggestedFixes: Use --prerelease flag to allow prerelease versions
Check if package has any stable releases

NU1605.title: Package downgrade detected
NU1605.explanation: Installing this package would downgrade a package that's already referenced at a higher version. This can cause assembly binding issues.
commonCauses: Multiple projects with different package versions
suggestedFixes: Update the package to the higher version
Update all projects to use consistent versions

NETSDK1045.title: Current SDK does not support target framework
NETSDK1045.explanation: The installed .NET SDK version is too old to support the target framework specified in the project file.
commonCauses: SDK version is older than target framework
Project targets newer framework than SDK supports
global.json restricts SDK to older version
suggestedFixes: Update to latest SDK: dotnet sdk update
Change target framework to supported version
Check global.json for SDK version constraints

NETSDK1004.title: Assets file not found
NETSDK1004.explanation: The project.assets.json file is missing. This file is generated during restore and is required for building.
suggestedFixes: Clean and rebuild: dotnet clean && dotnet restore && dotnet build
Delete bin and obj folders, then restore
Check for restore errors in previous commands
Verify NuGet package sources are accessible

NETSDK1005.title: Assets file is missing target
NETSDK1005.explanation: The project.assets.json file doesn't contain the target framework. This indicates a restore issue.
suggestedFixes: Clean restore: dotnet clean && dotnet restore
Verify target framework in .csproj is valid

NETSDK1022.title: Duplicate items included
NETSDK1022.explanation: Files are being included in the project multiple times, causing build conflicts.
commonCauses: Explicit ItemGroup includes default SDK includes
suggestedFixes: Remove explicit Compile items (SDK includes by default)

MSB3202.title: Project file could not be loaded
MSB3202.explanation: The project file is invalid or corrupted and cannot be loaded by MSBuild.
suggestedFixes: Restore from source control if corrupted
Create new project and migrate content

CS0234.title: Type or namespace does not exist in namespace
CS0234.explanation: The specified type or namespace cannot be found within the parent namespace.
suggestedFixes: Check package documentation for correct namespace
Search for type in package documentation

CS1061.title: Type does not contain definition
CS1061.explanation: The type doesn't have the specified method, property, or member.
commonCauses: Member added in newer version of library
suggestedFixes: Add using directive for extension method namespace
Update package to version with member
Check API documentation for member availability

CS0029.title: Cannot implicitly convert type
CS0029.explanation: An implicit type conversion is not possible between the two types.
suggestedFixes: Add explicit cast if conversion is valid
Change variable type to match assignment
Verify method return type matches usage

CS8600.title: Converting null literal or possible null value to non-nullable type
CS8600.explanation: Attempting to assign a nullable value to a non-nullable reference type (nullable reference types enabled).
commonCauses: Method returning null for non-nullable type
Nullable reference types enabled in project
suggestedFixes: Use null-forgiving operator (!) if null is impossible
Disable nullable reference types if not needed

NU1213.title: Package version constraint conflict
NU1213.explanation: Multiple packages have conflicting version constraints that cannot be satisfied simultaneously.
commonCauses: Package A requires B v1, Package C requires B v2
suggestedFixes: Use version ranges instead of specific versions
Check for package updates that resolve conflict
Remove one of the conflicting packages if possible

NETSDK1013.title: TargetFramework value not recognized
NETSDK1013.explanation: The TargetFramework specified in the project file is not a valid Target Framework Moniker (TFM).
suggestedFixes: Use valid TFM: net8.0, net6.0, netstandard2.1, etc.

MSB4019.title: Imported project not found
MSB4019.explanation: MSBuild cannot find an imported project file (.props or .targets).
commonCauses: Missing NuGet package with build assets
Path to imported file is incorrect
suggestedFixes: Verify imported file path is correct
Check file path casing on case-sensitive systems

CS0120.title: Object reference required for non-static field, method, or property
CS0120.explanation: Attempting to access an instance member without an object instance.
commonCauses: Calling instance method from static context
Trying to access instance member in static method
suggestedFixes: Create an instance of the class first
Make the member static if appropriate
Pass object instance to static method

CS0019.title: Operator cannot be applied to operands
CS0019.explanation: The operator cannot be used with the provided operand types.
suggestedFixes: Use appropriate operator for the types

NU1107.title: Version conflict detected
NU1107.explanation: Different projects in the solution reference different versions of the same package, causing a version conflict.
commonCauses: Manual package updates in some projects only
suggestedFixes: Update all projects to same package version

NETSDK1141.title: Unable to resolve SDK
NETSDK1141.explanation: The specified SDK resolver cannot resolve the SDK. This may indicate the workload is not installed.
suggestedFixes: Install required workload: dotnet workload install <workload-name>
List available workloads: dotnet workload list
For MAUI: dotnet workload install maui

NETSDK1004.title: Assets file 'project.assets.json' not found
NETSDK1004.explanation: The NuGet assets file is missing, which is required for the build. This file is generated during package restore.
commonCauses: First time building after cloning repository
suggestedFixes: Clean and restore: dotnet clean && dotnet restore
For new clones: dotnet restore before dotnet build
Check for restore errors in previous output
Verify network access to NuGet sources

CS0119.title: Invalid expression term
CS0119.explanation: A type name or namespace is being used where a variable, value, or method is expected.
commonCauses: Using type name instead of variable
suggestedFixes: Use a variable or property instead of type name
Check if you meant to call a static method

CS0128.title: Local variable already defined
CS0128.explanation: A variable with the same name has already been declared in the current scope.
commonCauses: Parameter name conflicts with local variable

CS1503.title: Argument type mismatch
CS1503.explanation: The argument type doesn't match the parameter type expected by the method.
commonCauses: Wrong argument type passed to method

CS7036.title: Missing required argument
CS7036.explanation: A required parameter is not provided when calling a method.
suggestedFixes: Verify you're calling correct method overload

CS0539.title: Member in interface implementation not found
CS0539.explanation: The member being implemented is not found in the base class or interface.
suggestedFixes: Check interface definition for correct signature
Use IDE refactoring to implement interface

CS0188.title: Variable used before assigned
CS0188.explanation: A local variable is being used before it has been assigned a value.
suggestedFixes: Ensure all code paths assign value

CS0165.title: Use of unassigned local variable
CS0165.explanation: A local variable is referenced before being definitely assigned.
commonCauses: Try-catch doesn't assign in all paths
suggestedFixes: Ensure all code paths assign value

MSB4062.title: Task could not be loaded
MSB4062.explanation: MSBuild cannot load a custom task from an assembly.
commonCauses: Package with build tasks not restored
suggestedFixes: Check task assembly path is correct

MSB3073.title: Command exited with error code
MSB3073.explanation: A custom build command failed with a non-zero exit code.
suggestedFixes: Check command output for specific error

MSB3275.title: Primary reference could not be resolved
MSB3275.explanation: A referenced assembly could not be found or loaded.

MSB3321.title: Importing keyfile failed
MSB3321.explanation: Cannot import the key file for strong-name signing.
suggestedFixes: Verify key file exists at specified path

NU1201.title: Project not compatible with framework
NU1201.explanation: The project or package doesn't support the target framework.
suggestedFixes: Update package to version supporting your framework
Check package documentation for supported frameworks

NU1403.title: Package content verification failed
NU1403.explanation: The package's signature or hash verification failed.
suggestedFixes: Clear NuGet cache: dotnet nuget locals all --clear

NU1106.title: Dependency constraint conflict
NU1106.explanation: Package version constraints from different dependencies conflict.
suggestedFixes: Add direct package reference with specific version
Check dependency graph: dotnet list package --include-transitive

NETSDK1064.title: Package not found
NETSDK1064.explanation: A NuGet package specified in PackageReference could not be found.

NETSDK1082.title: No .NET runtimes found
NETSDK1082.explanation: No compatible .NET runtime was found on the system.
suggestedFixes: Install matching runtime for target framework

NETSDK1100.title: Windows desktop components not installed
NETSDK1100.explanation: Windows desktop SDK components (WinForms/WPF) are not installed.
commonCauses: Windows desktop development workload not installed

CS0122.title: Member is inaccessible due to protection level
CS0122.explanation: Attempting to access a member (method, property, field) that is private or protected.
commonCauses: Trying to access private member from outside class
Protected member access from non-derived class
Internal member accessed from different assembly
suggestedFixes: Change member to public if appropriate
Access through public property or method

CS0161.title: Not all code paths return a value
CS0161.explanation: A method that should return a value has code paths that don't return anything.
suggestedFixes: Add return statement to all code paths
Add default return at method end
Ensure all branches return a value
Add return in switch default case

CS0115.title: No suitable method found to override
CS0115.explanation: Attempting to override a method that doesn't exist in the base class or interface.
suggestedFixes: Verify base class has virtual/abstract method
Use IDE tools to implement base method correctly

CS0507.title: Cannot change access modifiers when overriding
CS0507.explanation: The access modifier on an override member is different from the base member.
commonCauses: Trying to make override more restrictive
Trying to make override more accessible
suggestedFixes: Match access modifier of base member
Remove access modifier from override (inherits from base)

NU1603.title: Package dependency could not be resolved
NU1603.explanation: A package dependency cannot be satisfied due to version constraints or availability issues.
suggestedFixes: Clear NuGet cache: dotnet nuget locals all --clear

MSB3277.title: Found conflicts between different versions of the same assembly
MSB3277.explanation: Multiple versions of the same assembly are referenced, causing a conflict.
commonCauses: Different packages reference different assembly versions
Manual assembly references conflict with NuGet
suggestedFixes: Update packages to use same assembly version
Use package reference instead of assembly reference
